title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department states that showers or thundershowers will occur in several areas of the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Southern, and Uva provinces, as well as in the Nuwara Eliya and Ampara districts, after 2:00 p.m.

title: EC receives 180 election complaints ahead of LG Polls
byline: The Election Commission has announced that a total of 180 election-related complaints have been received thus far in relation to the upcoming Local Government election.

title: T-56 rifle and magazines found hidden in Matale
byline: Police have discovered a T-56 rifle and two magazines hidden in a suitcase in the Sudu Ganga Reserve within the Matale Police Division.

title: Myanmar quake death toll passes 1,600, as junta lets in foreign rescuers
byline: Myanmar’s military rulers let in hundreds of foreign rescue personnel on Saturday after an earthquake killed more than 1,600 people, the deadliest natural disaster to hit the impoverished, war-torn country in years.

title: Hamas agrees to Egyptian ceasefire proposal, Israel counters
byline: Hamas has agreed to a new Egyptian proposal to release 5 hostages, including the American-Israeli Edan Alexander, in exchange for a renewed ceasefire, a Hamas source tells CNN.

title: Person arrested for assaulting specialist doctor at Kegalle Hospital
byline: A person who assaulted a specialist doctor at the District General Hospital in Kegalle has been arrested.

title: Ex-Minister Tiran Alles summoned by CID over 2023 Weligama shooting
byline: Former Minister of Public Security Tiran Alles has been summoned by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to record a statement regarding the death of a police sergeant attached to the Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) during a shooting incident near a hotel in the Weligama area of Matara in 2023.

title: Britain to return artwork stolen by Nazis to Jewish family
byline: A 17th-century painting looted by the Nazis in 1940 from a Jewish art collector in Belgium will be returned to his descendants after spending three decades in a London gallery, the British government said on Saturday.

title: 2024 G.C.E. O/L Exam paper marking to begin April 1
byline: The Department of Examinations says that the paper marking process for the 2024 (2025) G.C.E. Ordinary Level (O/L) examination will commence on April 1.
